bibl.title: Portraits and Masks. Burial Customs in Roman Egypt.
bibl.note: tabl., figg., 1 carte et pll. 1-16 (coul.) et 17-48 (n./bl.).

Proceedings of a colloquium organized in July 1995 by the Department of Egyptian Antiquities at the British Museum (with the addition of several relevant papers). - Morris L. BIERBRIER, Preface, p. vii.
bibl.seg: BIERBRIER Morris L. (Ed.), Portraits and Masks. Burial Customs in Roman Egypt.
London, British Museum Press, 1997, 4°, viii-130 pp., tabl., figg., 1 carte et pll. 1-16 (coul.) et 17-48 (n./bl.). ISBN 0-7141-1904-0. £40.

Proceedings of a colloquium organized in July 1995 by the Department of Egyptian Antiquities at the British Museum (with the addition of several relevant papers). - Morris L. BIERBRIER, Preface, p. vii.

C.R. par David T. Frankfurter, BASP 36 (1999) pp. 147-151. - Margot Klee, BJb 198 (1998 [2001]) pp. 582-585 (collectif). - William H. Peck, AJA 104 (2000) pp. 412-413 [concerne aussi: Barbara BORG, "Der zierlichste Anblick der Welt ..." Ägyptische Porträtmumien (Mainz am Rhein, 1998].
